meanings.definition: A person who removes bobbins or spindles from textile machinery.
meanings.sent1: The doffers carefully took out the bobbins from the spinning machine.
meanings.sent2: The factory hired skilled doffers to handle the textile machinery.
meanings.sent3: The doffers joked about having to play 'bobbin removal experts' all day.
meanings.sent4: In the world of textile machinery, the doffers were the unsung heroes.
meanings.sent5: The doffers' role in the factory was crucial for the production process.

meanings.definition: To remove or take off (bobbins or spindles) from textile machinery.
meanings.sent1: She doffers the bobbins with precision every afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The workers doffers the spindles to prepare for the next batch of yarn.
meanings.sent3: He doffers the bobbins as if performing a graceful dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The machine hummed softly as it awaited the doffers' skilled hands.
meanings.sent5: Doffering the spindles required focus and attention to detail.
